meta.name: description
meta.content: Frontier School in Wolf Point is a school with a long tradition; many of our students' parents attended this school. During class, our faculty takes into account the many diverse ways that students learn.

Frontier School in Wolf Point is a school with a long tradition; many of our students' parents attended this school. During class, our faculty takes into account the many diverse ways that students learn.

body.class: body diyBgActive startpage cc-pagemode-default diyfeSidebarLeft diy-market-en_US

img.strong: Frontier School 6996 Roy St Wolf Point, MT 59201 (406) 653-2501

span.font: Parents are required to drop off/pick school work for their student.Â Â
span.span: The school foyer will be open from 7:30 am - 6:00 pm Tuesday's for drop off/pick up of classwork.. To minimize the number of individuals in the building at one time there will be a sign outside the building indicating whether the foyer is or is not occupied. There will be only 1 person allowed to enter the building at a time (PLEASE REFRAIN FROM BRINGING CHILDREN). We ask that, as you enter the building, turn the sign around to indicate others to "wait". Upon exiting the building, turn the sign to indicate to others that they may enter.

Middle school students are to join their scheduled classes via Google Classroom Monday-Friday on school days. The schedule is in the Google Classroom tab above. All online learning platforms are to be considered like a classroom setting, the same code of conduct and expecatations are required. Please discuss the importance of engaging in theÂ
virtual education provided.Â The teachers will be taking attendance, so please follow each teacher's attendance requirements.Â Assignments are required and grades are being earned during this time.Â
***To access your 5th-8th your child's grades please follow the link below.Â If you do not have your login, please contact Janece at Frontier School Main Office.**

The District is committed to ensuring accessibility of its website for students, parents, and members of the community with disabilities. All pages on the District's website will conform to the W3C WAI's Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AA conformance, or updated equivalents.Â Â Â Â Â

em.span: Under District developed administrative procedures, students, parents, and members of the public may present a complaint regarding a violation of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Section 504 related to the accessibility of any official District web presence which is developed by, maintained by, or offered through the District or third party vendors and open sources.
